result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney Lewis Bowman Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodney Lewis Bowman Sr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of Extended supervision or civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Charlisca H. without approval of the  Court.
No violent contact with Fannie B.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling or anger rmanagement and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfuly complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
  
AS TO COUNT #3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF3780), with credit for 1 day time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Charlisca H., 
   without approval of the court.    
* No violent contact with Fannie B. 
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Order For Contribution To Crime Fighting Organization;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld
Defendant appeared in court and was given the next court date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Court is unable to proceed to sentencing on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.  This case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defense counsel informs Court that defendant is late arriving to court.  Defense counsel is advised that defendant must appear in court today or a warrant will be issued.
Clerk:  jms

Court modifies no contact order with Fannie B as follows:
1. No violent contact.
2. Phone contact allowed for purpose of child care.
3. In person contact allowed on December 25, 2014 if other family members are present, and the case is not discussed.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing, however parties are requesting more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin
 Pursuant to plea negotitaions and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2 and COUNT #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #3: (as charged): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  PSI is not requested.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 12-22-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court maintains the current bail.  All conditions of bail, including the no contact order with Charlisca H., and Fannie B., until further order of the Court.   mld
Court vacates bench warrant for defaulting witness, Fannie Bowman.   mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Nemeth.
P.M.
Outside the presence of the jury, Court advised counsel of the discussions held earlier with juror #24, regarding his unconcern and lapses in timeliness.  Juror #24 was struck from the panel, with the agreement of counsel, the Court had ordered juror #24 to either pay a $500.00 fine or sit down in jury management for the remainder of this week.  

Jury in box.  Trial resumed.  Sworn for the State: Fannie B.  Exhibit 20 is played in open court.  Jury out of the box.  Defese objected to the playing of exhibit 20.  Court ordered the Defaulting Witness bench warrrant withdrawn for Fannie Bowman.  

Defense is prepared to enter a plea.  Case passed.   mld
from the State to Admit Fannie Boman's Statement Under Forfeiture of Wrongdoing, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered Body Attachment for:
--- Defaulting Witness, Fannie Bowman.    
WITH RETURN TO THE COURT.  mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Nemeth.
 A.M.
Stipulation placed on the record.  Court heard and denied defense Motion to Suppress (on case 2014CF3780).  Court heard and granted the motion of the State to reissue a body attachment for witness, Fannie Bowman.     

Jury in box.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Nemeth.  Exhibits 1 through 19 offered and received.  Exhibits 1 through 19 were published to the jury.  Jury out of the box.  In chambers discussions are placed on the record.  Jury in box.  Trial resumed with previously sworn: Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Nemeth.  Exhibits 22 through 33 offered and received.  Exhibits 22 through 33 were published to the jury.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Aleia Avant.  Jury out of the box.  Discussions held between the Court and counsel.  Parties approve with going forward, striking juror #24 and going forward with 12 jurors.  

Outside the presence of counsel and defendant, Court admonished juror #24, for his chronic lateness and being disruptive to the process.  Court found juror #24 in contempt and ordered a $500.00 fine.  Court will stay the fine, if juror #24, reports daily for the remainder of the week to Jury Management, on Tuesday, between the hours of 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, between the hours of 8:30 am and 4:30 pm, with daily lunch allowed.  Break for lunch.   mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Nemeth.
P.M. 
Case recalled.  State's Motion for Dismissal of Count #1 (on case 2014CF1802), is heard and granted by the Court.  
Count #1 dismissed without prejudice.  

Defense Motion to the presence of COUNT #2 is heard and denied by the Court.   Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  

For the purposes of trial, as to case 2014CF1802, Count #2 is renumbered Count #1, Count #3 is renumbered Count #2 and Count #4 is renumbered Count #3.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:40 pm. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury out of box.  In chambers discussions, with the Court, counsel and defendant, regarding strikes for cause, are placed on the record.   Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury out of box.  Jury Trial continued to Branch 4 on 11-4-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.   mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 FILE NOT IN COURT.
State moves for the consolidation of cases; 2014CF1802 and 2014CF3780.  Defense objects to the consolidation of cases.  Oral arguments heard.  Court grants the Motion of the State and ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CF1802 and 2014CF3780.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued in full force, per Order of the Court.   mld
as to Defaulting Witness, Fannie Bowman.   mld

 FILE NOT IN COURT.
Defaulting Witness, Fannie Bowman appears in court pro-se.
 Defaulting Witness was subpoenaed to appear for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-13-2014 and failed to appear.  The Court orders Fannie B. released on a PR Bond in the amount of $500.00.  Ms. Bowman agrees to return for Jury Trial on 11-3-2014 at 8:30, branch 4.  Ms. Bowman must contact the Victim Witness Service Unit, each Friday morning, until the date of trial.  Contact information will be provided by the State.  Court withraws bench warrant.   mld

 State requests a body attaghment against the witness, Fannie B., who was personally served and failed to appear for today's proceedings.  Court heard and granted State's Motion for a Body Attachment for Defaulting Witness; Fannie B.  Defense moves for dismissal of case.  Case passed.  

Case recalled.  Upon ther request of the State, Court ordered defendant to turn over his phone to the State until 2:00 pm.  State will try to obtain a seizure warrant.  If the State fails to bring back a warrant, phone will be returned to defendant, per the Court.   mld

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Randy Sitzberger for Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Joshua Nemeth-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests. Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Charlisca H and Fannie B

Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Rodney Lewis Bowman in custody.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Defense moves to dismiss repeater enhancer as to all counts.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss enhancer.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing to be heard by Judge Grady for Judge Flanagan.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
